title: Another Haryana cop found dead in Rohtak days after IPS alleged suicide
content:
A Haryana policeman was found dead on Tuesday, days after another cop also took his own life and accused in his “final note” several senior officers of harassment as well as caste-based discrimination.

Assistant sub-inspector (ASI) Sandeep Kumar's body was found in a room built near an agricultural field in Rohtak's Ladhot village on Tuesday.

The ASI was reportedly posted in the cyber cell and earlier was at the at SP office as well.

Speaking on the matter, SP Rohtak Surendra Singh Bhoria said, “This was a hardworking ASI of our Police Department, Sandeep. He was very honest and hardworking. His body has been found. A Forensic team has been called here and an investigation is being carried out...He was posted in Cyber Cell.”

This comes amid ongoing probe over Y Puran Kumar, a 2001-batch IPS officer, who allegedly died by suicide on October 7. In his “final note”, Kumar accused several senior officers, including Kapur and Bijarniya, of harassment and caste-based discrimination, which he claimed contributed to his emotional distress.

The Haryana government had on Saturday shunted out Rohtak SP Bijarniya, one of the cops against whom IPS officer Y Puran Kumar’s wife, IAS officer Amneet P Kumar, was seeking action for allegedly abetting his suicide.

The Chandigarh Police’s FIR was based on a ‘final note’ by the deceased police officer. Police have added charges under the SC/ST Act based on an appeal from the officer’s wife.
